prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples,"Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Normalize counts, make two PCA plots for samples, one color coded samples by "group" and the other color coded by "LibrarySelection" in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Install required packages
install.packages("readxl")
install.packages("dplyr")
install.packages("tidyr")
install.packages("ggplot2")
install.packages("factoextra")

# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(factoextra)

# Read the count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read the annotation data
annotation <- read_tsv("SRP021193.colData.tsv")

# Normalize the counts
normalized_counts <- log2(count_table[, -1] + 1)

# Perform PCA
pca <- prcomp(t(normalized_counts))

# Convert annotation data to a data frame
annotation_df <- as.data.frame(annotation)

# Create a data frame for the PCA results
pca_df <- as.data.frame(pca$x)

# Merge the annotation data with the PCA results based on sample ids
merged_data <- merge(annotation_df, pca_df, by.x = "SampleID", by.y = "row.names")

# Rename the merged data columns
names(merged_data)[8:ncol(merged_data)] <- paste("PC", 1:(ncol(merged_data)-7), sep = "")

# Create the first PCA plot color coded by "group"
pca_plot_group <- ggplot(merged_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot - Group", x = "PC1", y = "PC2")

# Create the second PCA plot color coded by "LibrarySelection"
pca_plot_library <- ggplot(merged_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = LibrarySelection)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot - LibrarySelection", x = "PC1", y = "PC2")

# Display the PCA plots
print(pca_plot_group)
print(pca_plot_library)
```
